intro: Ipomoea linosepala subsp. kundelungensis, commonly known as the Kundelungue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found climbing or trailing along vegetation. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
